sub_title: Director Elevated Experience, One Global Delivery, Phenom People
summary:
My name is Neli and I come from Bulgaria. I moved to the Netherlands in 2006 and after completing my Bachelor and Master studies I have had the chance to experience different work environments and team set-ups. 

Project Management

Having a personal contact with my stakeholders and customers is essential to me. 

I enjoy acting as a field agent and representing the brand externally – meeting new people, building and sustaining relationships, participating in strategic decision making and looking for win-win solutions. I am very ambitious and energetic.
 
I dare challenging old processes if I believe they do not help the company move forwards. 

I like setting challenging goals, making a plan and taking the actions to achieve them.

But what I like even more is making people enthusiastic and engaging them in achieving these goals together.

Writing

It's my passion to search for a deeper meaning than the daily operations. 

In my free time I read a lot about topics like: personal development, happiness, productivity, corporate mission and strategy, leadership, employee engagement, improving customer loyalty and satisfaction. 
I also love watching TED(x) videos for inspiration. 

I have a blog and every last Thursday of the month I publish an article on my personal website: nelimesyova.com.

By sharing my personal experience and thoughts on basic and existential topics, I hope I can help you lead happier and more fulfilling lives.

Curious to find out more about me and what I write about? Feel free to visit my website https://nelimesyova.com and don't forget to tell me what you think about the content I share and whether you find it useful.

profile_positions.description: In this role, I am delivering a white glove/elevated experience to our customers who are in critical stages of their onboarding process where speed and stakeholder management are key to the project's success. I am augmenting and strengthening both the Phenom and the client's project teams and providing an additional layer of governance and support during the onboarding process, leading a SWAT team to ensure smooth and on-time delivery and a high level of customer satisfaction.
profile_positions.title: Director Elevated Experience, One Global Delivery (OGD)

profile_positions.description: Responsible for onboarding new clients based in the Benelux and France region.
profile_positions.title: Director Client Services Benelux & France

profile_positions.description:
Phenom People is a global HR technology company with a mission to help a billion people find the right job. 

While our passion is to create jobs and help people find the one that’s right for them, we are not an HR company. We are a technology company that is redefining the talent experience.

We believe people should be happy and inspired by their jobs. That simple belief fuels our collective desire to fundamentally transform the talent journey.

We accomplish this task through an AI-based Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) platform called Talent Experience Management (TXM) that connects all the stakeholders — candidates, recruiters, employees, and management — in the talent lifecycle.

My role at Phenom is guide our customers through the implementation process.
profile_positions.title: Engagement Manager

profile_positions.description:
Carerix is a lead supplier for Applicant tracking software (ATS), specifically developed for the staffing and recruitment industry. 

In my role as a Project Manager I am responsible for guiding our new clients through the implementation of the various Carerix solutions. Thanks to my ability to empathize with my clients I am able to understand the frustrations and fears they experience when faced with the implementation of a new software. By providing a structured approach, clear plan and instructions as well as enough support and understanding I am able to build solid relationships with my clients, so they know they can trust and count on me during the whole implementation process. 

In the end, our software is meant to make their lives easier and more efficient, so they can focus on their core business: finding the most suitable role and company for their candidates.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
Harver makes the process of attracting, developing, retaining and motivating talent easier and more efficient by developing unique (pre)selection and talent management tools that support organizations and HR managers throughout the whole employee journey. The TalentPitch and PreSelect make sure that candidates are carefully and efficiently selected based on the skills, competencies and intelligence required for the relevant position. This ensures that you will only talk to the right people. 

My role at Harver was to guide the implementation of TalentPitch and PreSelect projects for clients mainly in the contact center branche but also in other industries. I was the first point of contact for the client and my responsibility was to make sure that the product was delivered within the agreed time and budget and the client experienced a smooth implementation process. I have guided implementations for various types of clients – smaller and larger commercial organizations, governmental organizations but also multiple municipalities. My latest two clients required also international implementations in Germany and Poland.

As we were a small team I often had to step into various roles. Besides project manager I also used to give training to the people who would be working with the test results and the back end of the tool, so I learned how to deal with a group of people who were often sceptical or resistant to change. After a product had been implemented I was also responsible for managing the client relationship. I have had regular contact with existing clients to see how things were going but also to perform and present evaluation analyses. Last but definitely not least all of us had to sometimes pick up the phone when a candidate was calling our support line with some technical struggles while completing the tests, so all in all very diverse role where every day was different!

Interested? Find more at www.harver.com
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
During the one and a half year traineeship programme at Vodafone I have completed projects in various departments.

September 2013 - January 2014 HR Resourcing team
- was the internal and external contact person for internships and campus recruitment - defined the 2013-2014 campus recruitment agenda, organized and participated in various recruitment activities, introduced a revised internship process
May - September 2013 HR Talent, Learning & Development and Internal Communications team
 - created the content, and coordinated the development and internal launch of an interactive online employee application
January - May 2013 Vodafone Thuis/Fixed Service team (Vodafone Consumer Business Unit)
- a go-to-market preparation of a new proposition (competitors' offers research and analysis, organization of a Friendly User Trial, creative launch ideas)
September - December 2012 Segment Marketing team (Vodafone Enterprise Business Unit) 
- defined a customer value proposition by coordinating between marketing and sales teams, developed proposition sales materials and presented them to the sales teams
profile_positions.title: Discover Management Traineeship

profile_positions.company: STAR Study Association Rotterdam School of Management
profile_positions.description:
The International Consultancy Project (ICP) is an ambitious project which involves the selection of 20 top students from the Strategic Management Master Programme at the RSM Erasmus University in Rotterdam and the organization of a 10 day trip to India. 

The trip consists of company visits, partner university visits but also cultural and sightseeing activities. The aim is to provide Master students with an opportunity to apply the academic knowledge gained during the years to real business situations but also gain invaluable intercultural experience.

My responsibility in the team is to find companies in the Netherlands that are interested in sponsoring our trip by organizing a workshop for the group prior to departure, recruitment event such as company dinner or/and drinks, or as an exposure opportunity.
profile_positions.title: External Commissioner of The International Consultancy Project 2011-2012
Corporate Communications Intern

company.name: Wereldkinderen via Stichting Laluz Voluntary City Program Den Haag

volunteer_experiences.description:
The Laluz Voluntary City Program Den Haag connects professionals with non-profit organisations in The Hague. The volunteers put their knowledge and experience from various industries in practice in the form of pro bono cunsulting under the supervision of experienced coaches.  

We are a group of six professionals with different personalities and backgrounds. Our challenge was to help the non-profit organisation Wereldkinderen come back to its core values and reinvent its mission and identity. During numerous open and honest brainstorm sessions with both directors we discussed various opportunities, asked critical questions, challenged the status quo and managed to co-create a whole new world of opportunities for Wereldkinderen. My key learning from this project: "If you act the way you've always acted, you will get the responses you have always gotten. Change is the only constant."

EP Niffic has started a new Holland Career Ambassador programme meant to help international students to start their career in The Netherlands. The Holland Career Ambassadors are internationals who have graduated in The Netherlands and already have experience in the Dutch job market. Our goal is to share our knowledge and personal experience and to inspire international students to be persistent and to not give up when facing challenges as they are part of the process.

Toastmasters International is a nonprofit educational organization that operates clubs worldwide for the purpose of helping members improve their communication, public speaking and leadership skills.

Besides constantly improving my public speaking skills by giving prepared and impromptu speeches, I enjoy supporting my fellow members at various speech contests and by giving them feedback during our regular meetings.
